lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project dialog first)
1. Set up the correct JDK version, as follows:
1. Click `Configure` > `Structure for New Projects` and then `Project Settings` > `Project` > `Project SDK`
1. If JDK 11 is listed in the drop down, select it. If it is not, click `New...` and select the directory where you installed JDK 11
1. Import the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.

1. After the importing is complete, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()`. If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below:
Duke is an offline application created with Java that allows users to keep track of tasks that they need
to complete. Duke is run from the command line.
Users are able to add new tasks. Three types of tasks are supported:
1. *Todo* - these tasks only have a description
2. *Deadline* - these tasks have a description as well as a date the task should be completed by
3. *Event* - these tasks have a description and a date that the event will take place
Ok! I've added the following task:
You now have 1 task(s) in the list.
Ok! I've added the following task:
You now have 2 task(s) in the list.
Ok! I've added the following task:
You now have 3 task(s) in the list.
Users can use this command to see their list of tasks.
I've printed your list of tasks below!
Users can mark their tasks as done when they are complete.
Ok! I've marked this task as complete!
Users can delete their tasks and remove them from the list.
Alright! I've deleted this task as requested!
Users are able to search for tasks in their list based on a keyword they enter.
I've printed out the tasks that contain 'Tuesday' below!
When users are finished using Duke, they can exit the program.
* The Duke class is the main class which runs, and is able to take in commands like todo and find,
* which helps the user record and manipulate tasks.
* Creates a Duke object which references Ui, TaskList, Parser, and Storage objects.
* Initializes a Duke object then runs the bulk of the code.
* Runs the methods required for the program to work, which mainly consists of taking in and executing
* user input, then subsequently saving it.
* The Parser class makes sense of the various commands that the user may input into the program and

* @throws DukeInvalidCommandException Exception if the user tries to execute a command that is not recognized.
* @throws DukeMissingDateException Exception if the user does not specify a date for the deadline or event tasks.
